Dear Parkview Parents,
As the situation with COVID-19 evolves, we can continue to follow the guidance provided by the Health Department, Center for Disease Control, and the New Jersey Department of Education (NJDOE). We are not closing school at this time.
In preparation for a potential school closure, all students PreK through Grade 12 have been provided with two weeks of learning materials today. For children in PreK through 2nd Grade, they now have a packet of material to complete and return. Students in Grades 3-6 will bring home their Chromebook and charger and their assignments will be available online. Please DO NOT have your child(ren) work on these materials. The learning assignments are only to be completed in the case of a school closure.
Please use this opportunity to plan for a potential closure as it may happen suddenly. Thank you for your understanding during this time as we work together to meet the needs of our students.

Parkview Elementary School 3rd graders welcomed PHL17's Ashley Johnson and illustrator artist, Maria Iannone, to unveil "Just Us", a book written by our own Mr. Hernandez, and narrated by our own Miss Peterson. “Just Us” is the 5th book Mr. Hernandez has published and the third book Miss Peterson narrated. Our students were able to ask the 8th grade illustrator questions about her art work. Students also shared their opinion of the book. This exciting visit will air on PHL17's Eye Opener morning talk show later next week.

Red Ribbon Week is the oldest and largest drug prevention campaign in the country. The purpose is to encourage individuals to take a stand against drugs and to make a personal commitment to live drug free lives with the ultimate goal of creating a drug free America.

Parkview celebrates Red Ribbon Week with the following themed days. Please show your support by participating!

Wednesday, 10/23: "These paws don't touch drugs"- Panther Pride- wear blue and white
Thursday, 10/24: "Hairs to a drug free life"-Crazy hair day
Friday, 10/25: "I'm a jean-ius, I'm drug free"- Wear jeans
Monday, 10/28: "Follow your dreams, don't do drugs"- Wear appropriate pajamas
Tuesday, 10/29: "Say peace out to drugs"- Dress like a hippie
Wednesday, 10/30: "Smarties don't do drugs"- Dress smart
Thursday, 10/31: "Drugs are scary"- Happy Halloween!
